head.title: PORT CHESTER: HIGH SCHOOL JOINS ANTI-VIOLENCE PROJECT

hedline.hl1: PORT CHESTER: HIGH SCHOOL JOINS ANTI-VIOLENCE PROJECT

abstract.p: Port Chester High School is among 11 schools in New York selected for anti-violence project sponsored by state Attorney General's office and Upstate Center for School Safety (S)

block.p: Port Chester High School is among 11 schools in New York selected for an anti-violence project sponsored by the state's Attorney General's office and the Upstate Center for School Safety in New Paltz. Other schools are in Buffalo, Hempstead, Middletown, Rochester and Syracuse. Each school is expected to have a team of students who will work with a faculty adviser to plan school-based programs to promote tolerance, civil rights and nonviolence and who will take part in a state conference on this issue this fall.

Port Chester High School is among 11 schools in New York selected for an anti-violence project sponsored by the state's Attorney General's office and the Upstate Center for School Safety in New Paltz. Other schools are in Buffalo, Hempstead, Middletown, Rochester and Syracuse. Each school is expected to have a team of students who will work with a faculty adviser to plan school-based programs to promote tolerance, civil rights and nonviolence and who will take part in a state conference on this issue this fall.
